channel.title: Comments for page "Lil Sara"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Lil Sara"

item.title: Linking
item.content:encoded:
The basic of creating a text link to a page

 [[[category:Page Name]]

example

 [[[items:Letter of Marque]]]

Letter of Marque

(Capitalation isn't important)

Some categories:

  • allies
  • items
  • trophy
  • awesome
  • jutsu
  • theme
  • summons

If a page has no category only use the Page Name

Advanced text linking:

 [[[category:Page Name|Link Name]]]

Example:

 [[[items:Sword of the Reaper|My Sword of the Reaper]]]

My Sword of the Reaper

Images

The basic of adding an image from other pages in the wiki

 [[image category:page-link/Image_Name.imagetype]]

Note: Spaces in page-links have to be "-" and "_" in Image_Name

Example:

 [[image allies:billy-lvl-2/Billy_Lvl._2.gif]]

To link an Image to a page

 [[image category:page-link/Image_Name.imagetype link="category:page-link"]]

Example:

 [[image allies:billy-lvl-2/Billy_Lvl._2.gif link="allies:billy-lvl-2"]]

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Okay, I added season 2 without the charbox for now, to note when I started it. I added bullets to stuff and I linked my bloodline.

What will be left:
-Link allies (with table)
-Link jutsus
-Link themes
-Link trophies (with table)
-Link perma items (with table)
-Maybe do as he did and link arena stats

I'm taking a break for now though.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Okay, checking the source code for Fyfe's page, I found out where he put the div style within the tab:

beginning of current tab -> put div style float left
end of CharBox content -> put /div
then add the 40 spaces

no problem with this format, repeat if there are more seasons (I currently only finished one)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Whatever div style I try to apply within a tab screws up other categories lower. Float apparently doesn't work right for what I want to do:

It erases my 40 spaces within my tab 'section' (for History's Season 1).
It makes other tabs slightly more to the right whenever I open Season 1.

This is the only way I found to make the CharBox left-aligned within the history tab anyways.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Okay did it too, just add "float right" before the charbox, so it includes both the charbox and the mission box, then they'll be one after the other.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Found the code to get tabs at 80% length.

That's one thing solved.

 [[div style="width:80%"]] [[/div]]

start the code after the charbox and mission box (or it forces them into the 80% too)
end it right before signature so its still truly centered

Now I still need to right-align the mission box. I did with [[code]][[div style="float:right"]][[/code]] but it stays on the same level as the charbox, I'd want it below.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Oh and I'd want my mission box aligning to the right, below my profile CharBox.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I was able to space it in History, with the " _" code (added 40 empty lines after the CharBox code).

I'd like to make the CharBox align to the left instead of the right (which it does by default).

I checked in the source code also: Fyfe uses tabs of 80% of the original length.
The html source code says: style="width:80%"

How do I code this for that page? I would include it in all my tabs.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Emtpy Tab

An empty tab is created by using a tab without any text:

 [[tabview]] [[tab Empty Tab]] [[/tab]] [[tab Not Empty Tab]] Not Empty [[/tab]] [[/tabview]]
  • Empty Tab
  • Not Empty Tab


Not Empty

Overlap

The easiest way to prevent the ally tab from overlapping the avatar is to fill in text between the top and the ally tab or use " _" to make empty rows (if used on the start of a row)

 _

I do not know any other ways to do it.

Mission Box

I think the missionbox is something some players have created manually so it isn't created automaticly by the wiki software like the other boxes, but here it is anyway, I can create a easier thing later, but I don't have time now. Insert numbers where the text is CAPPED

 [[table style="width:220px;font-size:small;cell-padding:-8;cell-spacing:-8;border:2px solid black;background-color:#DCF8DB;float:center"]] [[row]][[cell style="background-color:#04470A;text-align:center;color:#FFFFFF;border:2px solid black"]]Missions Completed[[/cell]][[/row]] [[row]][[cell style="background-color:#C0EFC5;text-align:center;color:black;border:0px solid black"]]D Missions: DMISSION[[/cell]][[/row]] [[row]][[cell style="background-color:#DCF8DB;text-align:center;color:black;border:0px solid black"]]C Missions: CMISSION[[/cell]][[/row]] [[row]][[cell style="background-color:#DCF8DB;text-align:center;color:black;border:0px solid black"]]Monochrome Missions: MONOCHROMEMISSION[[/cell]][[/row]] [[row]][[cell item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
I mean the history box ajusts to fit-in the charbox inside, while mine stays blank, doesn't lengthen (pushing down other stuff below), aligns it to the right by default. It also forces me to have Doujutsu levels/info (if I delete them, they still appear) even though I didn't have access to Burger Ninja missions in S1.

What I'd like basically:

-Have the tab background for my charbox within the history tabs so it lengtens downwards pushing down the Allies tabs when open.
-Have the tab box go less to the right than right into my avatar/charbox of the page (for all tab boxes).
-Have the avatar/charbox within the history tabs aligned to the left.
-Know how to link to images from the wiki as far as allies, jutsus, trophies, themes, and permanent items. Basically I want to 'copy' the layout of those pages with having the items info (loops or not, stats it gives etc) for allies, having the pictures, for themes, linking back to the source showing that one.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I based myself off Fyfe's page somewhat. He was able to limit the tab length so it wouldn't overlap his avatar/charbox and mission info on the right side, and was able to make the box longer. Sadly, since I can't edit that page, I also can't see its code, as far as tab-length, and "see source code" gives it to me in html, which doesn't help one bit when using javascript.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I added an history, but somehow, just like the regular charbox, it gets behind and overlaps with the tabs, instead of making the next area go lower. Thankfully I looped not long ago, so I remember what level I was and what items I had.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded:
Thanks. Well I managed to create tabs.

But now there's something. I want to have an "empty" tab, so it doesn't take as much space. I'd also like not to overlap my character avatar with the allies tab. I don't know how to add the mission box either.

Could you help me with those please?

item.title: Tab problem
item.content:encoded: The blocks [[code]] and [[/code]] aren't suposed to be before and after the tab

item.title: Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Thank you. I did it for signature.

The village of the signature won't match my current village (yesterday and early morning = Chiaki, now = none, tonight and until later = Invisible). I went to Chiaki only to Survive the Impossible. I'll be going back to Invisible as soon as my application is accepted (and it will be, given my 6 weeks of active membership). This is why I put my info on top as Invisible.

item.title: Code problems
item.content:encoded:
How the signature works:

You use a include in which you only insert your "Character ID" (it is the last 5 digits of the Billy/image link. example:"00000") where it says "your ID here".

how you did it:

 [[=]] [[include include:Signature image http://www.animecubed.com/billy/?73962 link="http://www.animecubed.com/billy/?73962"]] |id=YourIdHere [[/=]]

how it should be done:

 [[=]] [[include include:Signature |id=73962 ]] [[/=]]

this discussion page wont allow me to show the result, but it should work as I tested it on another page.

I also noticed that you didn't know the tab code so here it is:

 [[tabview]] [[tab TABNAME 1]] Something [[/tab]] [[tab TABNAME 2]] Somthing else [[/tab]] [[/tabview]]

result:

  • TABNAME 1
  • TABNAME 2

Something

Something else
